body: The root directory (`/`) isn’t ignored, it’s the user directory (`/~`) that is ignored. So the documentation is correct.

@nzakas Thanks for correcting me the difference between the root directory and the home directory. I updated the issue descrption.

But I still have the problem. Should the following 2 places be changed as "the home directory(not included)"? Because eslint will stop at the home directory now. See [eslintrc codes](https://github.com/eslint/eslintrc/blob/be0f70dacaa3ea1f0f606d240e5f63435b34810e/lib/cascading-config-array-factory.js#L363).

> up to **the root directory of the filesystem**

> until reaching either a .eslintrc file with root: true or **the root directory**.

I believe the documentation is correct as-is. The code in question treats the home directory as a root in that it won’t continue searching up the directory structure from there, but a normal config search will not hit the home directory.

Here is my simple test. When the config file is placed at `~/.eslintrc.json`,

```
[zhong@localhost jstest]$ ls ~/.eslintrc.json 
/Users/zhong/.eslintrc.json
[zhong@localhost jstest]$ pwd
/Users/zhong/Desktop/test/jstest
[zhong@localhost jstest]$ DEBUG=eslintrc:* eslint --print-config a.js

  eslintrc:config-array-factory Loading package.json config file: /Users/zhong/Desktop/test/jstest/package.json +9ms
  eslintrc:config-array-factory Loading JSON config file: /Users/zhong/Desktop/test/jstest/package.json +0ms
  eslintrc:config-array-factory Error reading package.json file: /Users/zhong/Desktop/test/jstest/package.json +1ms
  eslintrc:config-array-factory Config file not found on /Users/zhong/Desktop/test/jstest +0ms
  eslintrc:cascading-config-array-factory No cache found: /Users/zhong/Desktop/test. +2ms
  eslintrc:config-array-factory Config file not found on /Users/zhong/Desktop/test +0ms
  eslintrc:cascading-config-array-factory No cache found: /Users/zhong/Desktop. +0ms
  eslintrc:config-array-factory Config file not found on /Users/zhong/Desktop +0ms
  eslintrc:cascading-config-array-factory No cache found: /Users/zhong. +0ms
  eslintrc:cascading-config-array-factory Stop traversing because of considered root. +0ms

{
  "env": {},
  "globals": {},
  "parser": null,
  "parserOptions": {},
  "plugins": [],
  "rules": {},
  "settings": {},
  "ignorePatterns": [
    "a.js"
  ]
}
```

According to logs, you can see that the file is not found and the printed config object is almost empty. But if I moved the file to another place, as well as the subdirectory of the home directory,

```
[zhong@localhost jstest]$ mv ~/.eslintrc.json ~/Desktop/
[zhong@localhost jstest]$ DEBUG=eslintrc:* eslint --print-config a.js

  eslintrc:config-array-factory Config file not found on /Users/zhong/Desktop/test/jstest +0ms
  eslintrc:cascading-config-array-factory No cache found: /Users/zhong/Desktop/test. +1ms
  eslintrc:config-array-factory Config file not found on /Users/zhong/Desktop/test +0ms
  eslintrc:cascading-config-array-factory No cache found: /Users/zhong/Desktop. +0ms
  eslintrc:config-array-factory Loading JSON config file: /Users/zhong/Desktop/.eslintrc.json +0ms
  eslintrc:config-array-factory Config file found: /Users/zhong/Desktop/.eslintrc.json +3ms
  eslintrc:config-array-factory Loading parser "@babel/eslint-parser" from /Users/zhong/Desktop/.eslintrc.json +0ms
  eslintrc:config-array-factory Loaded: @babel/eslint-parser@7.15.0 (/Users/zhong/.config/yarn/global/node_modules/@babel/eslint-parser/lib/index.cjs) +6ms
  eslintrc:cascading-config-array-factory No cache found: /Users/zhong. +317ms
  eslintrc:cascading-config-array-factory Stop traversing because of considered root. +0ms

{
  "env": {
    "browser": true,
    "es6": true,
    "node": true
  },
  "globals": {},
  "parser": "/Users/zhong/.config/yarn/global/node_modules/@babel/eslint-parser/lib/index.cjs",
  "parserOptions": {
    "requireConfigFile": false,
    "ecmaVersion": 10,
    "ecmaFeatures": {
      "jsx": true
    }
  },
  "plugins": [],
  "rules": {
    "for-direction": [
      2
    ],
    "getter-return": [
      2
    ],
    ... ...
```

Now the file is found and loaded. Lots of rules are in the printed config object. Any mistakes?
Ah ok, so you are in a subdirectory of your user directory. Yes, in that case you will stop at the user directory instead of going all the way to the root. Sorry, I misunderstood.
@nzakas , shall I start working on this? Could you assign it to me?
@Deep1Shikha you are welcome to work on this. Please comment back here if you have any questions.
Hello @Deep1Shikha! Are you still working on this issue? If not, can I start working on this?

issue.body:
Fixes #14972

Some interest to make a PR was given by others in the past in the linked issue, but there hasn't been any activity from the original poster there after being asked for an update, so I decided to take a stab at fixing it. My apologies if that's considered inappropriate.

#### Prerequisites checklist

- [X] I have read the [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/eslint/eslint/blob/HEAD/CONTRIBUTING.md).

#### What is the purpose of this pull request? (put an "X" next to an item)

[X] Documentation update
[ ] Bug fix ([template](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/eslint/eslint/HEAD/templates/bug-report.md))
[ ] New rule ([template](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/eslint/eslint/HEAD/templates/rule-proposal.md))
[ ] Changes an existing rule ([template](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/eslint/eslint/HEAD/templates/rule-change-proposal.md))
[ ] Add autofix to a rule
[ ] Add a CLI option
[ ] Add something to the core
[ ] Other, please explain:

#### What changes did you make? (Give an overview)

Added some wording that when searching for configuration files the `~/` directory is also considered a root and searching will stop there. It also mentions that configuration files present in that directory will be ignored with the removal of support for Personal Configuration files.

#### Is there anything you'd like reviewers to focus on?

Nothing specific.
